title: Why enthalpy of dissolution is positive for CaF2

content.prompt: Which of the following best helps to explain why the value of ΔH° for the dissolving of CaF2 in water is positive?

choices.label: CaF2(s) dissolves in water to form CaF2(aq) particles.
Ca2+ ions have very strong ion-ion interactions with F- ions in the crystal lattice.
Ca2+ ions have very strong ion-dipole interactions with water molecules in the solution.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
